The ISS

How in the name of kerbal gods did you manage that?? Jeb would be proud.

I really like your mod !! Especially the Interplanetary probe pack you need to add more heat shield (just a bit bigger) It's really nice to make small probe and land them on other planets but I really can't make them to big which is a challenge for me and I love challenge

anyone got a working link to the probes?

I can only dl the station parts from op

anyone got a working link to the probes?

Sorry but this mod was abandoned a long time ago.

well, I had hoped it was just eaten by the kraken :/

Please resurrect this mod, add some textures, it looks great and fits the stock parts
Everybody that ressurects the mod needs the permission of Pelf to release it. And he's not been around for several months.

Everybody that ressurects the mod needs the permission of Pelf to release it. And he's not been around for several months.

Too bad, those were some nice models
I agree with you. What I could advice you is to update this pack yourself. I know it could be a bit complicated in the beginning, but you'll get your hand on it pretty easily

Yeah, I did it too. But even if you update the mod, you can't upload it so there's no point.

I thought he said something about he going to abandon it ,but that might have been wiped out in the big April derp. He also uploaded it for .18 compatibility ,but it doesn't completely work.

I thought he said something about he going to abandon it...

Whether a mod is abandoned or not is irrelevant. The only question is who holds the copyright and under what terms do they license it. Now, if you have a released version where the author commits the mod to the public domain, or licenses modification and redistribution, then you can upload an update. Otherwise, no, you can't, regardless of whether it was abandoned or not.

Honestly, if you want something like this the set of FusTek Expansion station parts is awesome, well designed and covers pretty-much all this mod did. Also most of the ISS Modules are available on the ISS Community mod.
